DataElement.preferredDefinition: The disease response in a target lesion using the Immune Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (iRECIST).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Target Lesion Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredDefinition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDISC aligned NCI CRF standards task. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity based on predetermined boundaries following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity based on predetermined boundaries following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease based on a predetermined threshold in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease based on a predetermined threshold in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

Concepts.definition: Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

Concepts.definition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

Concepts.definition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated Long Name and Definition to match current NCIt. mc 4/27/2020

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Target Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.:An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.longName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.
An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: iRECIST:  Immune Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST)-2017
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/19/19 jk added PVs (NE, Not Done, Not all evaluated) for DCI MEL_PPD1_101803 study.  10/7/18 jk Released per Fall 2018 Content Team review.  1/25/18 jk created for EORTC iRECIST follow up measurement form.
